item.title: 前汇丰交易员就经纪费警告索赔 140 万欧元
item.description: 汇丰控股公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）的一名前交易员在法国要求该银行支付 140 万欧元（150 万美元）的赔偿金，他声称，当他就高昂经纪费的潜在丑闻向高层老板发出警告时，该银行突然对他不利。【原文：A former HSBC Holdings Plc trader is demanding a €1.4 million ($1.5 million) payout from the lender in France, alleging it suddenly turned against him when he warned top bosses about a potential scandal over exorbitant brokerage fees.】

item.title: 板球运动进军美国，印巴大战每秒可卖 4,800 美元
item.description: 全球企业正在为即将在美国举行的印度和巴基斯坦板球比赛大做广告，以利用南亚侨民的消费能力。【原文：Global firms are splurging on advertising for the upcoming cricket match between India and Pakistan held in the US, tapping into the spending power of the South Asian diaspora.】

item.title: 诺和诺德引发丹麦工业生产自 2016 年以来的最大跃升
item.description: 在诺和诺德公司（Novo Nordisk A/S）和北欧其他制药业产量激增的推动下，丹麦的工业生产创下了近八年来的最大增幅。【原文：Denmark recorded its largest jump in industrial production in almost eight years, driven by a surge in output at Novo Nordisk A/S and the rest of the Nordic country’s pharmaceutical industry.】

item.title: 欧洲央行发出新通胀警告，首选薪资指标增速加快
item.description: 欧洲中央银行首选的欧元区薪资衡量标准显示，2024 年初欧元区薪资将加速增长，这是该地区物价压力顽固不化的最新迹象。【原文：The European Central Bank’s preferred measure of euro-zone pay showed acceleration at the start of 2024, in the latest sign that price pressures in the region are proving stubborn.】

item.title: 美国降息希望取决于更疲软的劳动力市场数据
item.description: 欢迎收看《每周固定》（Weekly Fix），这是一份没有任何重大利率、信贷或流动性不足风险的时事通讯。我是跨资产记者凯蒂-格雷菲尔德（Katie Greifeld）。【原文：Welcome to the Weekly Fix, the newsletter without any significant interest rate, credit, or illiquidity risk. I’m cross-asset reporter Katie Greifeld.】

item.title: 得益于贸易和消费，欧元区经济恢复增长
item.description: 年初，出口商和消费者推动欧元区经济恢复增长，抵消了投资下降的影响。【原文：Exporters and consumers drove the euro-area economy’s return to growth at the start of the year, offsetting a drop in investment.】

item.title: 首席执行官因会计问题辞职，C&C 公司股价暴跌
item.description: 在首席执行官帕特里克-麦克马洪（Patrick McMahon）卸任后，C&C Group Plc 的股价在伦敦暴跌，这家爱尔兰高端饮料制造商宣布将调整他担任首席财务官期间的部分账目。【原文：C&C Group Plc shares tumbled in London after Chief Executive Officer Patrick McMahon stepped down as the Irish premium drinks maker announced it will adjust accounts for part of the period when he served as chief financial officer.】

item.title: 铃木将停止在泰国生产汽车，专注于电动汽车转型
item.description: 铃木汽车公司周五表示，将于明年年底停止在泰国生产轿车和卡车，集中资源在其他地区生产电动汽车和混合动力汽车。【原文：Suzuki Motor Corp. will halt production of cars and trucks in Thailand by the end of next year to focus resources on producing electric and hybrid vehicles elsewhere, the company said Friday.】

item.title: 央行警告：爱尔兰预算不得助长通胀
item.description: 爱尔兰中央银行警告说，在进入预算周期之际，爱尔兰财政部绝不能助长通货膨胀。【原文：Ireland’s finance ministry must not fan the flames of inflation as it heads into a budgetary cycle, the central bank has warned.】

item.title: 施纳贝尔称欧洲央行不能在不确定的价格前景下预先做出承诺
item.description: 欧洲中央银行执行董事会成员伊莎贝尔-施纳贝尔（Isabel Schnabel）表示，欧洲中央银行面临着消费价格前景的高度不确定性，需要对借贷成本保持谨慎。【原文：The European Central Bank is facing high uncertainty about the consumer-price outlook and needs to stay cautious about borrowing costs, according to Executive Board member Isabel Schnabel.】

item.title: 中国人民银行在黄金价格创纪录后停止购买黄金
item.description: 中国央行上个月没有购买任何黄金，结束了在贵金属飙升至历史新高后持续 18 个月的大规模购买热潮。【原文：China’s central bank didn’t buy any gold last month, ending a massive buying spree that had run for 18 months after the precious metal surged to a record high.】

item.title: 美国银行哈特内特称美联储降息可能预示着经济将面临麻烦
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的策略师认为，美联储降息可能是经济陷入困境的信号。【原文：A Federal Reserve interest rate cut could be a signal of trouble for the economy, according to Bank of America Corp. strategists.】

item.title: 亿万富翁萨德的妻子掌管不断扩张的媒体帝国
item.description: 四十多年来，法国亿万富翁萨德家族一直对企业运营实行严格的家族控制。随着家族继承人罗多尔夫-萨德（Rodolphe Saade）的妻子开始掌管快速扩张的媒体部门，第二代萨德家族的这种做法也在不断加强。【原文：France’s billionaire Saade clan has kept business operations under tight family control for more than four decades. The practice is intensifying across the second-generation as scion Rodolphe Saade’s wife takes charge of their rapidly expanding media division.】

item.title: Makhlouf 称，目前尚不清楚欧洲央行将以多快的速度开展工作，如果有的话
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员加布里埃尔-马克鲁夫（Gabriel Makhlouf）表示，目前还不清楚欧洲中央银行何时会再次降息，或者是否会降息，因为通胀前景仍不明朗。【原文：It’s not clear when the European Central Bank will lower interest rates again — or if at all — as the inflation outlook remains uncertain, according to Governing Council member Gabriel Makhlouf.】

item.title: 击败 99% 同行的基金押注问题企业和人工智能失败案例
item.description: 富达国际有限公司（Fidelity International Ltd. ）的基金经理德米特里-索洛马金（Dmitry Solomakhin）逆流而上，却依然获胜。他的下一个赌注是被人工智能崛起击垮的股票。【原文：Going against the tide and still winning has worked for Dmitry Solomakhin, a Fidelity International Ltd. fund manager. His next bet is on stocks that have been crushed by the rise of artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 大选意外后全球基金对印度股市持谨慎态度
item.description: 外国人在印度股市的空头头寸接近历史最高水平，这表明即使在印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪赢得盟友的关键支持以组建政府之后，他们仍持谨慎态度。【原文：Foreigners’ short positions in Indian stocks held near a record high, underscoring continued caution even after Prime Minister Narendra Modi won crucial backing from allies to form a government.】

item.title: 莫迪联盟举行会议，有关职位和政策的游说活动愈演愈烈
item.description: 在总理纳伦德拉-莫迪赢得盟友支持的两天后，内阁职位和政策的争夺异常激烈。【原文：Two days after Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s won backing from his coalition of allies, there’s intense jockeying over cabinet positions and policies.】

item.title: 防务股需求强劲，Exosens 首次亮相巴黎即告上涨
item.description: 法国夜视技术公司 Exosens SAS 在巴黎首次公开募股后股价上涨，这反映了投资者对受益于国防开支增加的公司日益增长的需求。【原文：French night-vision technology firm Exosens SAS rose in its Paris debut, following an initial public offering which tapped growing investor demand for companies that are benefiting from increased spending on defense.】

item.title: 印度顶级基金经理在大选后都买了些什么？
item.description: 印度的顶级基金经理管理着近 1200 亿美元的股票资产，他们现在更青睐基本面强劲的大公司股票，因为本周的大选失利削弱了过去估值过高的赢家的吸引力。【原文：India’s top money managers, overseeing nearly $120 billion of equity assets, are now favoring shares of large firms with strong fundamentals as this week’s election upset dims the appeal of past winners with sky-high valuations.】

item.title: 香港计划于 9 月开始在台风期间进行交易
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，香港计划最快在 9 月份停止在恶劣天气期间关闭股市，允许在这种情况下像其他发达经济体一样进行交易。【原文：Hong Kong plans to stop shutting the stock market during severe weather as soon as September to allow trading in such conditions like in other advanced economies, according to people familiar of the matter.】

item.title: 摩根大通指数日期临近，印度储备创历史新高
item.description: 上周，印度的外汇储备增至 6,515 亿美元，创历史新高，因为在印度债券被纳入摩根大通银行（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：India’s foreign exchange reserves increased to a record high of $651.5 billion last week, as foreigners pile into its bonds ahead of their inclusion into JPMorgan Chase & Co. flagship emerging market debt index.】

item.title: 住宅建筑商 Bellway 发现英国住房市场出现复苏迹象
item.description: 贝尔威公司（Bellway Plc）表示，在销售量上升之后，有理由对英国住房市场持乐观态度。【原文：Bellway Plc says it sees reason for optimism in Britain’s housing market after an uplift in sales.】

item.title: 德国央行认为德国经济未来几年将保持良好势头
item.description: 德国联邦银行周五公布的最新预测显示，预计德国经济将在2024年缓慢获得增长动力，并在未来几年实现更强劲的增长。【原文：The Bundesbank expects the German economy to slowly gain momentum in 2024 followed by stronger growth in the years ahead, according to fresh forecasts published Friday.】

item.title: 交易员认为消费者乐观情绪在投票中得以延续
item.description: 策略师们表示，7 月 4 日英国大选之后，政治局势趋于平静，经济持续复苏，这些都将使消费者信心和零售业保持良好发展势头。【原文：The prospect of quieter politics and a continued economic recovery after the UK’s election on July 4 should keep consumer confidence and the retail sector on track, strategists say.】

item.title: 哈利法克斯（Halifax）称，英国 5 月房价下跌，延续停滞状态
item.description: 英国最大的抵押贷款机构之一表示，由于购房者面临着 16 年来最高利率对承受能力的限制，5 月份英国住房市场继续停滞不前。【原文：The UK housing market extended its stagnation in May as buyers faced constraints on affordability from the highest interest rates in 16 years, one of the nation’s biggest mortgage lenders said.】

item.title: 德国工业生产再次下滑，本季度开局不利
item.description: 德国 4 月份的工业产值出人意料地连续第二个月下降，表明欧洲最大经济体本季度的开局疲软。【原文：German industrial output unexpectedly fell for a second straight month in April, signaling a weak start to the quarter in Europe’s largest economy.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数有望创下一个月来最长涨势
item.description: 5 月 8 日（星期三），英国伦敦金融城英格兰银行（BOE）附近，上班族穿过一个十字路口。摄影师：Hollie Adams/Bloomberg【原文：Commuters cross a junction near the Bank of England (BOE) in the City of London, UK, on Wednesday, May 8. Photographer: Hollie Adams/Bloomberg】

item.title: 欧洲央行卡扎克称进一步降息需 "循序渐进
item.description: 理事会成员马丁斯-卡扎克认为，欧洲央行未来的任何降息行动都必须 "循序渐进"。【原文：Any future interest-rate reductions by the European Central Bank need to be “gradual,” according to Governing Council member Martins Kazaks.】

item.title: 中国对最大共同基金进行大规模审计审查
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，中国审计署正在对中国最大的共同基金进行全面的现场检查，这标志着中国审计署对该行业进行了最彻底的检查。【原文：China’s audit office is conducting comprehensive on-site inspections of the country’s biggest mutual funds, marking one of its most thorough examinations against the industry, according to people familiar with the matter.】
